title: The Masked Singer: Lindsay Lohan sets the record straight on diva rumours
text:
Lindsay Lohan has set the record straight on rumours she behaved like a 'diva' on set of The Masked Singer Australia.

Speaking on the Kyle and Jackie O Show, on Friday, the 33-year-old actress said that people were just digging for 'negativity'.

'People want to find the negative for no reason,' she said.

Scroll down for video

'People want to find the negative for no reason': Lindsay Lohan set the record straight on rumours she was a diva on The Masked Singer

'There was nothing negative about [filming The Masked Singer],' Lindsay said, adding that people should 'just be happy' all the judges got along well.

Jackie 'O' Henderson, who is also a judge on The Masked Singer, also said that production was 'the best experience' and 'so much fun'.

It comes after Wendell Sailor claimed that Lindsay had held up production by taking an unexpected hour-long break on the day his final performance was filmed.

I'm tired of rumors starting! The 33-year-old said people are searching 'negative' things to talk about instead of focusing on the positives

Wendell, who was unmasked as the Rhino on Tuesday's episode, told Kyle and Jackie O the following day: 'About a minute before I had to perform, they said, "Lindsay's hungry, she's going to have a break."'

'It was like an hour break! We were there for a while,' he added.

The former rugby player, 45, added he was forced to wait in his dressing room during Lindsay's break because he wasn't allowed to talk to anyone on set.

'We were there for a while': Wendell, who was unmasked as the Rhino on Tuesday's episode, revealed that Lindsay held up his performance and production by taking an hour-long break

Revealed: The former Rugby Union star, 45, said he was forced to wait in his dressing room during Lindsay's break because he wasn't allowed to talk to anyone on set for hours

Dave Hughes, who is also a judge on The Masked Singer, previously revealed that Lindsay's cigarette breaks disrupted a pre-production workshop.

He said one of her breaks was so long they started the workshop without her.

He explained: 'The discussion was had: "Let's start, we don't know how long Lindsay's going to be".

'We thought maybe she's not going to come back!'

The Masked Singer Australia continues Monday at 7.30pm on Channel 10
